title: HOMELAB_INFRA.EXE
objective: Cloud-native homelab managed via GitOps on Hetzner VPS

sections.title: SYSTEM_OVERVIEW
sections.content: A production-grade homelab infrastructure hosted on Hetzner VPS, serving as the technical foundation for DevOps & Cloud Engineering mastery. The entire stack is orchestrated using Docker and managed via Dockge, following a modular approach for scalability.

sections.title: INFRASTRUCTURE_AS_CODE
sections.content: Adopts a strict GitOps workflow where all configuration changes are versioned and audited before application. Infrastructure provisioning is handled by Terraform and configuration management by Ansible, ensuring a reproducible and immutable environment.

sections.title: CORE_SERVICES
sections.content:
• Security & Identity: Authentik (SSO) and HashiCorp Vault for secret management.
• Observability: Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, and AlertManager for real-time monitoring.
• Development: Gitea for git mirroring and Code-Server for remote development.
• Data Protection: Restic integration with Backblaze B2 for offsite backups.

sections.title: SECURITY_ARCHITECTURE
sections.content: Implemented a secure-by-design approach with strict `.gitignore` policies and environment variable management. Traefik handles edge routing with automatic SSL, while internal services are protected via Authentik middleware. Real-time observability ensures high availability and rapid incident response.

sections.title: OPERATIONAL_METRICS
sections.content:
• Infrastructure: Hetzner VPS
• Management: Dockge / GitHub Actions
• Backup Strategy: Restic + Backblaze B2
• Uptime: Monitored by Uptime Kuma

title: GREENROOTS_ECOM.EXE
objective: Global reforestation initiative with solar-powered aesthetic

sections.title: PROJECT_OVERVIEW
sections.content: A premium, high-fidelity e-commerce platform dedicated to global reforestation. It connects users—both individuals and organizations—with impactful tree-planting projects worldwide, facilitating direct contribution to biodiversity and climate action.

sections.title: DESIGN_PHILOSOPHY
sections.content: Built with a Sustainable Web Design philosophy, featuring a unique 'Solar-Powered / Low-tech Magazine' aesthetic. The visual style utilizes a high-fidelity retro look with analog dithering effects and organic color palettes. The UI adapts programmatically based on the project's continent (e.g., specific color grades for Europe, Asia, Africa), emphasizing clarity, transparency, and the beauty of nature.

sections.title: TECHNICAL_IMPLEMENTATION
sections.content: Frontend is powered by React Router (v7) and Vite, styled with a modular, variable-based Vanilla CSS architecture for dynamic theming. The backend utilizes Node.js and Express.js with PostgreSQL for data persistence. The entire infrastructure is containerized with Docker, using Traefik as an edge router for automatic SSL, and orchestrated via a robust GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline.

sections.title: KEY_ACHIEVEMENTS
sections.content:
• Implemented a custom, performance-friendly CSS-only dithering effect to achieve the retro aesthetic without heavy assets.
• Built a robust CI/CD pipeline ensuring code quality (linting, type-checking) and automated production deployment.
• Designed a scalable folder structure distinguishing between feature-based modules and shared components.

sections.title: OPERATIONAL_METRICS
sections.content:
• Infrastructure: Docker & Traefik
• Testing: Vitest & Playwright
• Payments: Stripe Integration
• Deployment: GitHub Actions

title: PORTFOLIO_SYSTEM.EXE
objective: Professional presentation interface with NieR aesthetic

sections.title: PROJECT_OVERVIEW
sections.content: A NieR: Automata inspired personal portfolio showcasing development projects and skills. The design captures the game's distinctive UI aesthetic while maintaining modern web standards and accessibility. Built to stand out from typical developer portfolios while remaining professional and functional.

sections.title: DESIGN_PHILOSOPHY
sections.content: Recreated the authentic NieR: Automata interface with parchment backgrounds, geometric layouts, and terminal-style typography. The design system uses CSS custom properties for theme consistency and implements dark/light mode switching that maintains the aesthetic in both contexts. Every element is carefully crafted to feel like it belongs in the game's world while serving a practical purpose.

sections.title: TECHNICAL_IMPLEMENTATION
sections.content: Built with Angular 19 and Tailwind CSS using a custom design system. The architecture is fully containerized using Docker and deployed via a GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline. It utilizes Traefik as a reverse proxy for automatic SSL management and routing. The application follows Angular best practices with standalone components, lazy loading, and optimized build processes.

sections.title: CHALLENGES_SOLVED
sections.content:
Challenge 1: Balancing aesthetic authenticity with web accessibility
Solution: Created high-contrast color schemes that pass WCAG guidelines

Challenge 2: Automated Deployment on VPS
Solution: Implemented a robust CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions and Docker

Challenge 3: Performance with complex visual effects
Solution: CSS-only animations and optimized asset loading
